result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leon Kahill

records.addlTxt:
1:44 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Leon Kahill in court.  Attorney Christy M Hall in court for Leon Kahill. Court Reporter Donna Moore. 

Parties are prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing today. 

State puts offer on the record. Defense confirms offer. 

Plea questionnaire filed. Court holds plea colloquy with defendant. 

Case 21CM545
Plea - Ct. 2: GUILTY 
State consents to jury waiver. 
Agreement to use complaint for factual basis. 
BTC: GUILTY. Ct. 1 is dismissed but read in. 
Parties give arguments as to sentencing. 

BTC: 45 day in patient treatment ordered. 
Deft is Ordered to provide a DNA specimen;
Court Costs+ DNA surcharge, 60 days to pay.

BTC: Case 22CM791 is dismissed but read in.
DA Authorization to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence

***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

2:10 PM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Leon Kahill appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Natalie Probst appeared by video for Leon Kahill. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.
Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Initial appearance on July 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
